page.title: 07The Home Farm Trust.
page.content: The Home Farm Trust is a residential home for disabled people, and the thirty one residents are mentally handicapped. They live at the Home under the care of a Resident Manager who has the help of both full-time and part-time staff on a shift basis. The Trust was started twenty one years ago by parents, and there are now nine houses. The Trust receives some financial support from Local Government, but fundraising is also organised. The residents work in the gardens and help in the house, tending flowers, vegetables, and the animals. Any surplus of produce is sold. They have access to well-equipped craft and pottery studios. Small groups go on accompanied holidays, sometimes overseas.
